HDG.LOG.content: [Nietzsche-like] forgetting to meditate on essential origin of reason, let itself into its advent (Ankunft) [arrival] > more originally (ursprünglicher), legein as “bringing together,” legere as lesen, collecting & bringing together (Zusammenbringen)

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LOG.content: [Heidegger’s ear] hearing more than just picking up sounds, if it is [anatomical, biological], goes in one ear out the other [but, apprehension lives (lebt) only when embodied (leibt)] > in that case, we are not gathered to what is addressed (Zugesprochene) [heterotautology of hearing and hearkening (Horchen)] > wrong direction: turn anatomical hearing into a spiritual one

HDG.LOG.content: logos: destined (vom Geschick) to be appropriated (er-eignet) in omologein ——now that saying of Heraclitus speaks more clearly [oh yeah?]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: logos: destined (vom Geschick) to be appropriated (er-eignet) in omologein ——now that saying of Heraclitus speaks more clearly [oh yeah?]

HDG.LOG.content: path for mortal thinking [?], in more primordial origin of logos [?] > logos needs omologein if present beings are to shine in presencing > omologein dispatches itself w/out presumption into the measuring (schickt sich unvermessen in das Ermessen) of logos [that Being needs human logos?]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: path for mortal thinking [?], in more primordial origin of logos [?] > logos needs omologein if present beings are to shine in presencing > omologein dispatches itself w/out presumption into the measuring (schickt sich unvermessen in das Ermessen) of logos [that Being needs human logos?]

HDG.IM.content: “Being” as universal, most comprehensive, nothing above and beyond “Being”: the more indeterminate/empty its content

HDG.IM.linkedContent: “Being” as universal, most comprehensive, nothing above and beyond “Being”: the more indeterminate/empty its content

HDG.IM.content: German idealism didn’t collapse, age wasn’t great enough to stand up to greatness, breadth, originality of spiritual world, to realize it (more than apply propositions/insights) > Dasein began to lack depth (from which essential comes/returns to human beings), a leveling, no more rank (a blind mirror that no longer mirrors) [w/out rank, can’t stand up to greatness of spirit, but what about the greatness of killing that spirit? (e.g. Nietzsche)]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: German idealism didn’t collapse, age wasn’t great enough to stand up to greatness, breadth, originality of spiritual world, to realize it (more than apply propositions/insights) > Dasein began to lack depth (from which essential comes/returns to human beings), a leveling, no more rank (a blind mirror that no longer mirrors) [w/out rank, can’t stand up to greatness of spirit, but what about the greatness of killing that spirit? (e.g. Nietzsche)]

HDG.BC.content: knowing, standing, a stance, knowing ground is more originary, more far-reaching [value], more decisive: this knowing is character itself > a claim upon us, exhorted (angesprochen) [addressed] > meleta to pan, “take into care beings as a whole”: always consider the essential, first & last [put last first]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: knowing, standing, a stance, knowing ground is more originary, more far-reaching [value], more decisive: this knowing is character itself > a claim upon us, exhorted (angesprochen) [addressed] > meleta to pan, “take into care beings as a whole”: always consider the essential, first & last [put last first]

HDG.BC.content: [phony inheritance] love of antiquity pretext to evade every decisive reflection > readiness to confront inception more vital than knowledge of any languages [but still must know Greek?] > readiness can originate as genuine (echte) only from necessities of history in which we’re placed: insistence on possession of truth makes remembrance of inception impossible

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.BC.linkedContent: [phony inheritance] love of antiquity pretext to evade every decisive reflection > readiness to confront inception more vital than knowledge of any languages [but still must know Greek?] > readiness can originate as genuine (echte) only from necessities of history in which we’re placed: insistence on possession of truth makes remembrance of inception impossible

HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.BC.content: realm of beings not identical to domain of actual (also: stringency of necessary, wealth of the possible) > strikes ordinary understanding as a truism: a being either possible, actual or necessary > what passes itself off as even more self-evident: “beings” are [“is” method]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: realm of beings not identical to domain of actual (also: stringency of necessary, wealth of the possible) > strikes ordinary understanding as a truism: a being either possible, actual or necessary > what passes itself off as even more self-evident: “beings” are [“is” method]

HDG.BC.content: more difficult to say how “being” belongs to subject than object? > flight from object to subject a questionable way out of question of “being”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: more difficult to say how “being” belongs to subject than object? > flight from object to subject a questionable way out of question of “being”

HDG.BC.content: Nietzsche’s “being” as “last breath of a vaporizing reality”: what happens to ontological difference in this disappearance [can’t Nietzsche affirm a more ancient difference, i.e. differance?]?
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s “being” as “last breath of a vaporizing reality”: what happens to ontological difference in this disappearance [can’t Nietzsche affirm a more ancient difference, i.e. differance?]?

HDG.BC.content: “is” must be empty acc. its essence [khōra] > [Being as fetish]“is” distinguishes itself through poverty of meaning, even more so for noun “being”: emptiness/indeterminacy made into a fetish: being as most real being
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “is” must be empty acc. its essence [khōra] > [Being as fetish]“is” distinguishes itself through poverty of meaning, even more so for noun “being”: emptiness/indeterminacy made into a fetish: being as most real being

HDG.BC.content: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings

HDG.BC.content: remembrance into first inception is fore-thinking into more incipient inception > remembrance is placement into Being itself > Being remains closer to us than everything nearest, farther than all that is farthest > only appear to escape Being in favor & for sake of beings, whose density fills every openness > must become aware of our abode: becoming aware not just raising Being into consciousness [not mindfulness]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.BC.linkedContent: remembrance into first inception is fore-thinking into more incipient inception > remembrance is placement into Being itself > Being remains closer to us than everything nearest, farther than all that is farthest > only appear to escape Being in favor & for sake of beings, whose density fills every openness > must become aware of our abode: becoming aware not just raising Being into consciousness [not mindfulness]

HDG.W.content: what is more truly worthy [of poet’s thought, of thought] than word’s being veiling itself, the fading word for the word > oldest word for rule of word: logos—the same word, word for Saying, is word for Being, the presencing of beings
HDG.W.linkedContent: what is more truly worthy [of poet’s thought, of thought] than word’s being veiling itself, the fading word for the word > oldest word for rule of word: logos—the same word, word for Saying, is word for Being, the presencing of beings

HDG.BT.content: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]

HDG.WM.content: nothing more originary than negation, given > absurdity of question of nothing due to a blind conceit of intellect? > not be misled by formal impossibility > if nothing is to be questioned as we have been questioning it, must be given beforehand [facticity]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: nothing more originary than negation, given > absurdity of question of nothing due to a blind conceit of intellect? > not be misled by formal impossibility > if nothing is to be questioned as we have been questioning it, must be given beforehand [facticity]

HDG.WM.content: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: turn away from nothing into beings: hasten into public superficies of our existence > what testifies (zeugt) to manifestation (Offenbarkeit) of nothing in our existence more than negation? > “not (das Nicht)” more original [?] than negation, negating only one way of nihilating (one way of comporting grounded beforehand in in nihilation of nothing) [annihilation is another way?] > “not” becomes manifest only when nihilation of nothing disengaged from concealment: idea of “logic” disintegrates in turbulence of more originary questioning [has this been proven?]

HDG.WM.content: list of more burdensome forms of nothing than negation: unyielding antagonism, stinging rebuke, galling failure, merciless prohibition, bitter privation
HDG.WM.linkedContent: list of more burdensome forms of nothing than negation: unyielding antagonism, stinging rebuke, galling failure, merciless prohibition, bitter privation

HDG.IWM.content: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

HDG.IWM.content: for a preliminary orientation, nothing more necessary than question: “What is metaphysics?”
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: for a preliminary orientation, nothing more necessary than question: “What is metaphysics?”

HDG.QB.content: thinking needed urgently, granted that [if?] an adequate experience of this essence [essence of nihilism] can be prepared only in a responsive thinking [always preparing adequate experience] > essence of nihilism is heal-less (Heil-lose), unique pointer toward salutary [cf. p. 322 w/ hearty greetings] > if thinking to approach (nähern) realm of essence of nihilism, must necessarily become more precursory (vorlaüfiger) & thereby become other [totally other???]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.linkedContent: thinking needed urgently, granted that [if?] an adequate experience of this essence [essence of nihilism] can be prepared only in a responsive thinking [always preparing adequate experience] > essence of nihilism is heal-less (Heil-lose), unique pointer toward salutary [cf. p. 322 w/ hearty greetings] > if thinking to approach (nähern) realm of essence of nihilism, must necessarily become more precursory (vorlaüfiger) & thereby become other [totally other???]

HDG.QB.content: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.QB.linkedContent: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.QB.linkedContent: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.QB.content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

HDG.QB.content: crossing through (Durchkreuzung) not merely negative sign of a crossing out: X as four regions of fourfold > human essence belongs, in X of Being, to that which takes thinking into claim of a more originary call [e.g. X Being would imply replacement w/ Ereignis]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.QB.content: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing is not beings but nevertheless given: Being & nothing employ (verwendet) themselves one for the other in kinship (Verwandtschaft) whose essential fullness [why full?] we’ve scarcely heeded (kaum bedacht) [not yet there] > there is a giving (Es gibt) > Being no more “is” than nothing: Es gibt both [giving then beyond Being?]

HDG.QB.content: [Heidegger’s method as Destruction then building (for dwelling)?] build path (Weg) leads back to locality (Ortschaft) of recovery (Verwindung) of metaphysics to let us journey through what is destined in overcoming (Überwindung) nihilism [not there yet, narrative yet to come] > despite rejection of text for publication [annihilation of trace], he who learns must examine more originarily, w/ greater care, the saying of reflective thinking, might leave such saying in realm of mystery one day, as highest gift (höchstes Geschenk) & greatest danger [beyond Being, the worst, totally other, risk annihilation?]

HDG.QB.content: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)

HDG.FS.content: adverb aei, “always already”: more eternal than everlasting (former does not dominate time [w/ presence?])

HDG.FS.linkedContent: adverb aei, “always already”: more eternal than everlasting (former does not dominate time [w/ presence?])

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “a torn sock is better then a mended one…” > to understand (Verstehen), must see (sehen) phenomenologically, invitation to phenomenological “kindergarten”: to tear apart (Zer-reissen), to tear in 2 parts, to separate, make 2 out of 1: torn sock no longer present-at-hand [sock appears outside its usage, w/ more force (Kraft)] > diese Einheit [the unity of the whole sock] ist im Zerrissensein [being-torn] als verlorene [lost] Einheit gegenwärtig

HDG.FS.content: when power of conjoining disappears, unity itself is experienced [?]: must speak of unity before (vor) dichotomy > pre-philosophical approach, phenomenological in more authentic sense
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when power of conjoining disappears, unity itself is experienced [?]: must speak of unity before (vor) dichotomy > pre-philosophical approach, phenomenological in more authentic sense

HDG.FS.content: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”

HDG.FS.content: limit of body is skin, limit of “lived-body” more difficult to determine, not “world” > only world where there’s language, i.e. understanding of being

HDG.FS.content: [phenomenological exercise on Louvre more important that reading Hegel]

the a of alētheia, a privation that corresponds to excess, privation is not negation, the concealment in unconcealment (which grows more powerful the more strongly it becomes what phuein indicates [?])
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the a of alētheia, a privation that corresponds to excess, privation is not negation, the concealment in unconcealment (which grows more powerful the more strongly it becomes what phuein indicates [?])

HDG.FS.content: Greek philosophers, more Greek than Greek, asked question of being but not question of alētheia as such > question concerning being as being never been posed (gestellt)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Greek philosophers, more Greek than Greek, asked question of being but not question of alētheia as such > question concerning being as being never been posed (gestellt)

HDG.FS.content: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.FS.linkedContent: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

HDG.FS.content: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.FS.linkedContent: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)

HDG.FS.content: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

motif.name: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT
motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

motif.name: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT
motif.title: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (UNIVERSITY, POPULAR) via KANT

HDG.FS.linkedContent: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]

HDG.FS.content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

HDG.FS.content: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: there is a return to beginning in Being and Time, but it is through destruction, dismantling, disintegration (Auflösung) (which is sometimes awkward [ungeschickt] [?]) of what is destined as being in metaphysics > not yet in Being and Time a genuine knowledge of history of being, hence the awkwardness, naiveté of “ontological destruction” > since then, unavoidable naiveté of novice gave way to a knowing [he arrived, no more destruction?]

HDG.FS.content: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in Greek manner, einai means to presence (Greeks speak more revealingly (zeigender)/precisely than we do) [Heidegger’s bias?] > Parmenides’ esti gar einai, genuine tautology: names Same only once, as itself: [fragment 8] “the same dwelling in the same, it lies in itself” [cf. 80 verse is eukuklos, abundant/overflowing, says on its own complete tautology] > in domain of inapparent (Unscheinbaren): presencing itself presences (anwest Anwesen selbst): “great number of indications (Zeignisse) [marks? traces?]…”, indication as sēma, what shows & lets be seen

HDG.MA.content: artist present in sounds of his music: master’s presence in the work, only true presence > greater the artist, more his person vanishes behind his work [MOP]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: artist present in sounds of his music: master’s presence in the work, only true presence > greater the artist, more his person vanishes behind his work [MOP]

HDG.MA.content: meditative thinking (like calculative thinking [?]), requires greater effort, demands more practice [askesis], must be cared for, must wait > anyone can follow path of meditative thinking in own manner, w/in own limits: man is a thinking/meditating being
HDG.MA.linkedContent: meditative thinking (like calculative thinking [?]), requires greater effort, demands more practice [askesis], must be cared for, must wait > anyone can follow path of meditative thinking in own manner, w/in own limits: man is a thinking/meditating being

HDG.CCP.content: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult

HDG.CCP.content: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]

HDG.CCP.content: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]

HDG.DL.content: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.DL.linkedContent: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

HDG.DL.content: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: each man, each instant, in dialogue w/ forbears, perhaps even more, and more hidden, w/ those who will come after (Nachkommen) [inheritance, promise, future full of ghosts]

HDG.DL.content: we’re all clumsy questioners (unbehlofener Frager) [following unwritten prescription (ungeschriebenen Vorschrift)], despite much care, keep overlooking essentials [arrival?] > we notice quite late our carelessness re: words, because language is more powerful/weightier than we are

HDG.DL.content: to think Greeks in even more Greek manner doesn’t mean better than them: great thinking understands itself best, i.e. understands itself, w/in limits set for it (zugemessenen Grenzen) > to think more originally than Greeks: to think the unthought clearing (Lichten), the occurrence (Ereignis) [?] of emergence (Hervorkommen) into openness (Lichte) [?], unconcealedness (appearance of that which is present)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.content: [re: method of “Expression and Appearance”] never did more than follow a faint trail (Wegspur) > die Spur (dark, perplexing, lightning-sharp, sudden insight [Einblick] [instant]): almost imperceptible promise (vernehmbares Versprechen) announcing (ankündete) we’d be set free into open (ins Freie) > eluded every effort to say it

HDG.LP.content: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)

HDG.LP.content: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm
HDG.LP.linkedContent: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.content: poet’s work is only a listening, it’s language becomes a saying after (nachsagenden) > poetry’s spoken word guards Gedicht, as that which remains, essential in it, unspoken > when the saying-after must listen, becomes more pious, i.e. fügsamer gegenüber dem Zuspruch des Pfades [more fittingly submissive re: the promptings of the path] [traces?]

HDG.LP.content: is [all] this dreamy romanticism of modern world (technology, economics) or clear knowledge of “madman”? he who sees more than what’s in the latest news, the current happenings [social media]

HDG.WL.content: the more language shows (zeigt) its own character (Eigenen), more significant (bedeutsamer) the way to language becomes for language itself, our formula [p. 112] becomes a soundless echo (lautloser Anklang), letting us hear something (ein Geringes) of proper character (Eigentümlichen) of language

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.content: way to language: approach more closely language’s own peculiar character (dem Eigentümlichen der Sprache näherzukommen) > here too language shows itself as our way of speaking: attend only to those things, noticed (beachtet) or not, that join/have voice (mitspricht) in language

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.TC.content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.EC.content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.EC.linkedContent: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

HDG.EC.content: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: doesn’t this thought that Being is malicious (bösartig) in the Ground of its essence (im Grunde seines Wesens) place an awful demand (arge Zumutung) on human thinking? > even more when one should not regard the idea that evil dwells in essence of Being as pessimistic > that thinking should be easy is a thought from spirit of devastation [spirit of revenge?]

HDG.EC.content: young man wants to keep heart/mind free of the disturbing aura (Anhauch der Verstörung) of all ill-humored thinking [self-righteousness] > more essential the insight, the greater the tact it awakens in fellow men

HDG.EC.content: hasty to think of man as thinker, mortal (Sterbliche) in distinction (im Unterschied) from immortal, thnētos, [finitude], a deeper definition of human than thinker? > poets more commonly refer to man as mortal
HDG.EC.linkedContent: hasty to think of man as thinker, mortal (Sterbliche) in distinction (im Unterschied) from immortal, thnētos, [finitude], a deeper definition of human than thinker? > poets more commonly refer to man as mortal

HDG.EC.content: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.EC.content: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)

HDG.EC.content: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: nationality: pure subjectivity of a people, relies on its “Nature” as what’s actual (Wirkliche), and all effecting (Wirken) comes from and goes back to this “Nature” > in subjectivity, man asserts himself as ground/measure of what’s actual > thus emerges (entspringt) the uprising (Aufstand) into work as form of achievement through which devastation of earth becomes unconditional [in German one more sentence than in English: Das einzige Gesetz der Verwüstung ist, dass das Nötige das Nötigste und das allein Nötige sei] > business of devastation: work for sake of increased possibility of work [Marxish?]

HDG.EC.content: can do nothing more humble (Geringeres) than calmly letting ourselves engage in waiting (uns gelassen auf das Warten einzulassen)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: can do nothing more humble (Geringeres) than calmly letting ourselves engage in waiting (uns gelassen auf das Warten einzulassen)

HDG.EC.content: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent

HDG.OHF.content: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]

HDG.OHF.content: [Hegel as objective scientific philosophy] “Spirit” now lives in abode (Ort) of its self-certainty, no more goals, feelings, interests: “life has retired (zurückgezogen) into its authentic freedom”

HDG.OHF.content: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”
